item.title: Advent of Code 2022 Day 11: Monkey in the Middle
item.description: Functions as input, and modular monkeys.

item.title: Functional Options in Go and Rust
item.description: The Functional Options Pattern is a safer alternative to struct literals, and is commonly used in Go. These are the challenges I encountered when trying it out in Rust.

item.description: Convert terminal output to tree structure of files and directories

item.description: Flood fill in a more literal sense. Implemented using DisjointSet, also known as Union-Find algorithm.

item.description: Decoding scrambled seven-segment displays using bitwise set operations.

item.description: How to render graphs in both Obsidian and Hugo using the same input file.

item.description: Hotkeys, tips and tricks for the note taking software Obsidian.

item.title: Advent of Code 2021
item.description: It’s happening! Finally December is here, and a new Advent of Code begins. I’ll try to write a very short post for each of my solutions.
